content:
How to Delete Windows Genuine Advantage Notifications Tool Without Hacking 
 Home Random Browse Articles Notifications Add to This Page Add Tip Easy Ways to Help Approve Questions Review Tech Feedback Fix Spelling More Things to Try...   
 Log in / Sign up   
 Desktop Site   
 Talk How to Delete Windows Genuine Advantage Notifications Tool Without Hacking   
 If you have a bootleg (fake) copy of Microsoft Windows XP with the  Windows Genuine  Advantage Notifications Tool installed, irritating messages reminding you that you have a bootleg copy of Windows installed on your PC appear once every hour or so. Microsoft has made it so that the uninstall feature on this doesn't exist, but there`s a way to simply delete the tool rather than uninstall it. If possible, doing things without hacking is always the better option as it provides much less chance of something going wrong with your systems configuration. Please note that  this is not a hacking. 
 Steps Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/15\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/15\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Click on Start>My Computer. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/62\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-2-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/62\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-2-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Type the following text into the address bar at the top of the page  C: \WINDOWS\system32
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/78\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-3-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/78\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-3-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Locate the file called  WgaTray  or  WgaTray.exe  and click on it once. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/46\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-4-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/46\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-4-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 Press the  shift+delete  keys (this combination will automatically delete the files completely off your PC instead of to the Recycle Bin) but don’t confirm the deletion yet. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d5\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-5-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d5\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-5-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 5 
 Right click on a non-occupied area of the taskbar and select  Task Manager  or press Ctrl + Shift + Esc. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cc\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-6-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cc\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-6-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 6 
 Click on the  Processes  tab at the top. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/34\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-7-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/34\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-7-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 7 
 Select the process called  WgaTray.exe  and click the  end process  button at the bottom and click  yes  to confirm the process termination. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/06\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-8-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/06\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-8-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 8 
 Confirm the delete of the  WgaTray  that you semi-deleted earlier (this must be done almost immediately after the process termination because it will re-open itself quickly so it’s a good idea to have the deletion confirmation window open behind the task manager for fast access). 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/01\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-9-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/01\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-9-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 9 
 Restart your PC. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5e\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-10-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5e\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-10-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 10 
 In the  system32  folder that was opened earlier, find and select the file called  WgaLogon.dll  and drag it into the  Recycle Bin  (located on the  Desktop ). 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/80\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-11-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/80\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-11-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 11 
 Empty your  Recycle Bin . 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/09\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-12.jpg\/v4-460px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-12.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/09\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-12.jpg\/v4-760px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-12.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 12 
 Restart your PC and the  Windows Genuine Advantage  Notifications Tool shouldn’t run anymore so now you have completely hassle free Windows XP usage. 
 Advertisement 
 Alternative method Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/73\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-13-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/73\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-13-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Start PC in "Safe Mode. " , ( To Open Safe Mode , Reboot Your PC And Press the F8 key before Windows starts. )
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8d\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-14-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8d\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-14-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Search wga and wgalogon two files in system32 windows folder. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d0\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-15-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d0\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-15-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Change their extension to wga.ol and wgalogon.old. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8f\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-16.jpg\/v4-460px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-16.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8f\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-16.jpg\/v4-760px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-16.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 Restart PC in normal mode.  Notification on the desktop has disappeared.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8e\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-17-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-17-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8e\/Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-17-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Delete-Windows-Genuine-Advantage-Notifications-Tool-Without-Hacking-Step-17-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 5 
 Open "C: \Windows" folder and inside it the "system 32" folder. Delete both wga.old and wgalogon.old files. In this way you have got free from Windows genuine advantage problem.
 Advertisement
